title: USB-C port is not working as it should
content:
The usb-c port doesn't work all the times. I realised about this problem when music started to stop playing while having the earbuds connected. And then I found out I have the same problem when i try to charge my pixel 3 with a cable. (Usually I use wireless charging)
So the phone would charge only if the cable is leaning towards the right side. I can feel the end of the cable moving a little bit while it is plugged inside of the phone. Leaned on the left it doesn't charge, leaned on the right it works.

Clearly this is very annoying, especially while using the earbuds because for example I can't put my phone in my pocket or else the music is stopped.

To be sure it wasn't the cable problem I tested this with 3 different USB-C cables (Google and Apple originals) and the original pixel earbuds.
In order to exclude damaged cables or accessories I tried them on my Macbook and they work properly.

Is there anything I can do to fix this problem?
Thank you.
